[[File:XC3 Creeping Hameel.png|thumb|Creeping Hameel]] '''Flaks''' are a family of enemies in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. They are creatures from [[Origin]].
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Kurria Flak (normal)|Kurria Flak]] * [[Migia Flak]] * [[Zoah Flak]]
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Clinging Azreel]] * [[Creeping Hameel]]
=== Boss === * [[Kurria Flak (boss)|Kurria Flak]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Boss === * [[Vatura Flak]]
== Gallery == <gallery> Kurria Flak Boss.jpg|Kurria Flaks XC3 Clinging Azreel.png|Clinging Azreel Vatura Flak.jpg|Vatura Flak </gallery> {{clr}}
{{xc3 stub}}

[[file:Prosperous Zepar.png|thumb|Prosperous Zepar in {{XC|-}}]] '''Flamiis''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|フラミー}}, ''Furamī''; [[English dub pronunciations|English dub]]: {{IPA|/ˈflæmi/}}) are a species of aerial monsters in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They are flamingo-like creatures (hence the name Flamii), tend to be found around water, and come in three colours; blue are likely to be non-aggressive, pink are likely to be aggressive and white are uncommon.
[[Ageshu]] behave similarly to Flamii, and may be related.
== {{XC|-}} == In {{XC}}, Flamiis are found on both [[Bionis]] and the [[Fallen Arm]] of [[Mechonis]]. They are a fairly common species, and are found in the following areas: [[Colony 9 (XC1)|Colony 9]], [[Bionis' Leg]], [[Satorl Marsh]] and the Fallen Arm. The highest-leveled Flamiis are the [[Resplendent Flamii (XC1)|Resplendent Flamii]], which can reach up to Level 74, although the Level 73 Unique Monster [[Flailing Bracken]] has higher stats.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Black Flamii]] * [[Kukukoro Flamii]] * [[Lacus Flamii]] * [[Lahar Flamii]] * [[Lake Flamii]] * [[Marsh Flamii (XC1)|Marsh Flamii]] * [[Oasis Flamii]] * [[Opulent Flamii (XC1)|Opulent Flamii]] * [[Resplendent Flamii (XC1)|Resplendent Flamii]] * [[Satorl Flamii]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Assault Flamii]] (during ''[[Earnest's Mischief]]'')
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Amber Fischer]] * [[Enchanting Grune]] * [[Flailing Bracken]] * [[Prosperous Zepar]]
== {{XCFC|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Lake Flamii]] * [[Resplendent Flamii (XC1)|Resplendent Flamii]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Terpsichorean Cenoth]]
== {{XC2|-}} == In {{XC2}}, Flamii can be found in the [[Gormott Province]], [[Kingdom of Uraya]], and [[Leftherian Archipelago]]. === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Biban Flamii (XC2)|Biban Flamii]] * [[Blue Flamii]] * [[Crimson Flamii]] * [[Limdo Flamii (XC2)|Limdo Flamii]] * [[Nyol Flamii]] * [[Rebra Flamii]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Ambushing Flamii]] (during ''[[The Titan Scholar]]'') * [[Punishing Flamii]] (during ''The Titan Scholar'')
== {{TTGC|-}} == In {{TTGC}}, Flamii can be found in the [[Kingdom of Torna]] and on [[Gormott (TTGC)|Gormott]], although white Flamii do not appear.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Dominal Flamii]] * [[Lefth Flamii]] * [[Libelte Flamii]]
== {{XC3|-}} == In {{XC3}}, Flamii can be found in the [[Aetia Region|Aetia]] and [[Cadensia Region|Cadensia]] regions.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Biban Flamii (XC3)|Biban Flamii]] * [[Limdo Flamii (XC3)|Limdo Flamii]] * [[Marsh Flamii (XC3)|Marsh Flamii]] * [[Opulent Flamii (XC3)|Opulent Flamii]] * [[Resplendent Flamii (XC3)|Resplendent Flamii]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Migratory Circe]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Marsh Flamii (XC3)|Marsh Flamii]] * [[Resplendent Flamii (XC3)|Resplendent Flamii]]
== Gallery == === {{XC|-}} === <gallery> Flamii.jpg|Blue Flamii Red Flamii.jpg|Pink Flamii Lacus Flamii.jpg|White Flamii </gallery>
=== {{XC2|-}} === <gallery> Biban flamii.jpg|Biban Flamii Blue Flamii.jpg|Blue Flamii XC2 Limdo Flamii.jpg|Limdo Flamii </gallery>
=== {{TTGC|-}} === <gallery> Lefth.jpg|Lefth Flamii LibelteFlamii.jpg|Libelte Flamii </gallery>

{{Spoiler}} {{quote|An Attacker, pressuring foes with a dual-sword style and felling them in short, vicious bouts.|Class menu description}} [[File:Flash Fencer Class Icon.png|thumb|180px|The Flash Fencer class icon]] '''Flash Fencer''' is a [[Keves]]i [[Attacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] in {{XC3}}. == Overview == Flash Fencer is the class of [[Ethel]] and the first [[Hero]] class unlocked. It focuses on pressuring foes with a dual sword style and felling them in short bursts. The class is unlocked by completing ''[[No Want of Courage]]'', and is inherited by [[Noah]]. Its max rank increases to 20 upon having reached rank 10 in both Flash Fencer and [[Seraph]] classes, and then going to the now-unlocked lab in [[Colony Omega]]. {{clr}} == Class Aptitude and Unlock Requirements == {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:100%; valign:center;" !Party Member |[[File:Icon chara battle n0ah.png|60px]]
'''[[Noah]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 1.png|60px]]
'''[[Mio]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 2.png|60px]]
'''[[Eunie]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 3.png|60px]]
'''[[Taion]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 4.png|60px]]
'''[[Lanz]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 5.png|60px]]
'''[[Sena]]''' |- !Aptitude |[[File:XC3 Aptitude S Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude D Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude C Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude A Icon.png|35px]] |- !Class Unlock Points Required |''Class Inheritor'' |3,300 |5,775 |4,125 |4,950 |2,475 |} == Class Rank Requirements == {| class="xc1 centered" width="45%" ! Rank ! CP needed ! Nopon Coin Cost |- | 1 | colspan="2" | None |- | 2 | 185 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 3 | 185 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 4 | 230 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 5 | 230 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 6 | 280 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 7 | 280 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 8 | 300 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 9 | 300 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 10 | 325 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | colspan="3" class="event" | Achieve Rank 10 with Flash Fencer and [[Seraph]], go to [[Colony Omega]], and have Ethel undergo the maturation process. |- | 11 | 355 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 12 | 355 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 13 | 470 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 14 | 470 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 15 | 585 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 16 | 585 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 17 | 705 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 18 | 705 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 19 | 765 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 20 | 880 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |} {{clr}} == Class Stats == The Flash Fencer class grants the following multipliers to a character's base stats (see their individual pages for their base stats), and sets their Physical and Ether Defense to the following values, depending on their current Rank. Intermediate values are linearly interpolated between the minimum and maximum values, rounding to the nearest percent. {| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 70% || 100% || 20% || 110% || 100% || 10% || 10% |- | 10 || 72% || 105% || 22% || 115% || 105% || 12% || 12% |- | 20 || 75% || 110% || 25% || 120% || 110% || 15% || 15% |} === Weapon Stats === The character's Attack stat after being modified by the above class stats is further modified by adding the class's weapon stat, which depends on the character's [[Level (XC3)|Level]], to obtain the final base Attack stat. These weapon stats also determine the character's Critical Rate and Block Rate. Characters temporarily assume these weapon stats to calculate relevant statistics when using a Master Art from this Class without it being part of a Fusion Art. If a Master Art is used in a Fusion Art, the character's current Class will be used instead for calculations. {| class="xc1 centered" width="60%" ! Level !! Attack !! Critical Rate !! Block Rate |- | 1 || 19 || 20% || 4% |- | 10 || 41 || 21% || 4% |- | 20 || 75 || 22% || 5% |- | 30 || 116 || 23% || 5% |- | 40 || 161 || 24% || 6% |- | 50 || 216 || 25% || 6% |- | 60 || 275 || 26% || 6% |- | 70 || 341 || 27% || 7% |- | 80 || 416 || 28% || 7% |- | 90 || 500 || 29% || 8% |- | 99 || 585 || 30% || 8% |} == Arts == * '''[[Saber Strike]]''' (Talent Art), [[Smash (XC3)|Smash]] * '''[[Cross Impact (XC3)|Cross Impact]]''', [[Power Charge]] on hit (Rank 10 Master Art) * '''[[Null Slash]]''', AOE/Side Crit. Rate+ * '''[[Hidden Thorn (XC3)|Hidden Thorn]]''', [[Bleed (XC3)|Bleed]] (Rank 1 Master Art) * '''[[Revolution Edge]]''', Back Attack Up * '''[[Acceleration]]''', Auto-Atk spd. up/dmg up === Hero-exclusive Arts === * '''[[Swallowtail (XC3)|Swallowtail]]''', Back Attack ↑ * '''[[Silver Cyclone]]''', Side Crit. Rate+ * '''[[Million Flash]]''', Bleed == Class Skills == * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 2.png]] '''First Move Wins''', Boosts damage dealt by 30-50% for the first 30 seconds of battle. * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 31.png]] '''Capable Hands''', Fills Talent Art recharge gauge by 60-100% at start of battle. (Rank 15 Master Skill) * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 3.png]] '''Critical Strike''', Increases critical hit damage bonus by 30-50 percentage points. (Rank 5 Master Skill) * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 31.png]] '''Fighting Instinct''', Boosts damage dealt by 25-50% when using a Talent Art (up to a maximum of 200%). === Stat Increases === {| class="xc1 centered" style="width:80%;" !Class Rank !First Move Wins !Fighting Instinct !Critical Strike !Capable Hands |- | 1 | 30% | 25% | 30% | 60% |- | 5 | 35% | 30% | 35% | 70% |- | 10 | 40% | 35% | 40% | 80% |- | 15 | 45% | 40% | 45% | 90% |- | 20 | 50% | 50% | 50% | 100% |} == Trivia == * Flash Fencer's fighting style is based off of Niten-Ichi-Ryu. Which is said to be the use of a short sword, and a longer sword. == Gallery == XC3 Ethel Artwork.png|Ethel Flash Fencer Noah.png|Noah as a Flash Fencer Flash Fencer Mio.png|Mio as a Flash Fencer Flash Fencer Eunie.png|Eunie as a Flash Fencer Flash Fencer Taion.png|Taion as a Flash Fencer Flash Fencer Lanz.png|Lanz as a Flash Fencer Flash Fencer Sena.png|Sena as a Flash Fencer {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Classes]]

revision.comment: Created page with "{{Infobox item |name = Flawless Crystal |image = |caption = Boosts damage dealt by 65% per enemy defeated (to a maximum of 250%). |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = [[Prize X-change Blue]] |sell = [[Gold|G]] }} '''Flawless Crystals''' are DLC [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}}. It can be purchased from [[Prize X-change Blue]] in the [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] for 6000 [[Noponstone]]s...."

revision.text:
[[file:Weather Flier.jpg|thumb|Flier model]] '''Fliers''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|フライア}}, ''Furaia'') are an enemy family in the {{XC|serieslink}}. They are flying insects which look similar to butterflies. All fliers have the same appearance.
== {{XC|-}} == They are only active in the day.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Atmos Flier]] * [[Clima Flier]] * [[Clowd Flier]] * [[Colony Flier]] * [[Fine Flier]] * [[Happiness Flier]] * [[Weather Flier]]
== {{XCFC|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Clowd Flier]]
== {{XC2|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Acenia Flier]] * [[Bright Flier]] * [[Sweet Flier]]
=== Challenge Battle Mode Enemy === * [[Petal Flier]]
== {{TTGC|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Astor Flier]] * [[Lapse Flier]] * [[Legia Flier]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemy === * [[Incub Flier]] (During ''[[Homegrown Inventor]]'')
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Illumi Flier]] * [[Light Flier]] * [[Kroda Flier]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Perturbed Bilkin]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Baruka Flier]] * [[Cave Flier]] * [[Light Flier]] * [[Prom Flier]]
== Gallery == === {{XC|-}} === <gallery> Happiness flier.png|Happiness Flier </gallery>
=== {{XC2|-}} === <gallery> Acenia flier.jpg|Acenia Flier </gallery>
=== {{TTGC|-}} === <gallery> Lapseflier.jpg|Lapse Flier </gallery>
=== {{XC3|-}} === <gallery> Light Flier.png|Light Flier Perturbed Bilkin.png|Perturbed Bilkin </gallery>
